content.question: In another trial, the speed of the carts immediately after the collision is <math alttext="0.60 meter per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.60</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the carts slide <math alttext="0.24 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.24</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> on the horizontal surface before coming to rest. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the sliding carts and the surface is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
